screen_name: "And I can see now that’s all I ever wanted for you. To be happy. Foolishly, I thought I could be the one to make you happy. So I dragged you down into my world with me. And for that, I am truly, eternally sorry. Hey, do you feel that really cold breeze?” https://t.co/bXx7ccRQd8

@lindaholmes Yeah. I'm torn. I remember that Ray Charles was a producer on Ray. And he was insistent that they include the philandering and drug use, as the other producers wanted to soft-pedal that stuff. He was adamant it be ugly and not a hagiography.
@shawnabenson No shake shack near me, or within my delivery radius. Sadly. So very sadly.
@Simms2673 @RhettReese if shake shack were anywhere near me, it'd be in the bracket. And the service nature of the bracket renders one-off restaurants like Apple Pan somewhat invalid...
(Also, we chose the restaurants in the bracket based on drive-time and delivery radius. So if your fave isn't here—hell, my fave, Shake Shack isn't here—that's why.)

@thecameroncuffe Like, I think In N Out might be the best burger you can get from a drive-thru—though Wendy's might be a solid challenger—but it's not the best chain hamburger in Los Angeles. Shake Shack, for one, blows it out of the water.
Imagine that: the place that specializes in chicken won a ChickySando taste contest. https://t.co/J5wys1B5tA
